item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals New Skins for Scarlet Witch and Adam Warlock
item.description:
Summary

  • New skins for Scarlet Witch and Adam Warlock in Marvel Rivals will be available on May 22 at 7 PM PDT.
  • Chrono Shield Cards have been added to the game, which allow players to prevent point loss in Competitive matches.
  • Marvel Rivals has reintroduced the Season 0 battle pass for a limited time.

Marvel Rivals has revealed that new skins for both Adam Warlock and Scarlet Witch will be coming to the popular hero shooter's shop on May 22 at 7 PM PDT. NetEase Games recently released Marvel Rivals' second season, which brought Emma Frost to the game. It's expected that the villain Ultron will also be making his debut with the launch of a major mid-season update.

NetEase Games made some waves in the community recently when it announced that it would be adding a new item called Chrono Shield Cards to Marvel Rivals as part of its Galacta's Gift event. Chrono Shield Cards function similarly to Chrono Shield Tokens, as they prevent players from losing points when they suffer a defeat in Competitive matches. While many people were worried that this could ruin the balance of Competitive play, NetEase Games announced that the item could not be bought with real money and could only be used by players who are Gold rank or lower.

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games revealed that new skins for Marvel Rivals ' Scarlet Witch and Adam Warlock will be coming to the game's shop on May 22 at 7 PM PDT. Scarlet Witch's costume is called Immortal Sovereign and shows the hero in a red dress with deep purple accents. The highlight of the skin appears to be the golden light that shines throughout her hair, ribbons, and hands. It's a fresh look for the hero, as most of her skins focus solely on red, which is her signature color. Many fans have been enthusiastic about the skin, with some stating that they'll be purchasing it immediately to give their own Scarlet Witch a radiant appearance.

Marvel Rivals Is Releasing New Scarlet Witch and Adam Warlock Skins May 22

Marvel Rivals ' Adam Warlock, who typically sports a golden appearance, has donned a darker outfit. His clothes are primarily black with gold accents and a touch of jade on his belt. He also has two dragons peeking over his shoulders, which give the hero a fearsome look. As of writing, NetEase Games hasn't announced how much either skin will cost, but many people are already looking forward to getting their hands on the fresh cosmetics when they come to the store.

Despite a bit of controversy, NetEase Games has also brought back Marvel Rivals ' Season 0 battle pass for a limited amount of time. Players who wish to take advantage of its return will need to buy it by May 29. The developers have stated that they might be open to bringing back more battle passes in the future, though they will cost more Lattice than when they made their initial debut. With so much content to enjoy and even more on the way, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Sea of Stars Releases Long-Awaited Free DLC Expansion
item.description:
Summary

  • Throes of the Watchmaker DLC for Sea of Stars offers eight hours of new content, more playable classes, and a new character.
  • The DLC introduces a carnival-themed clockwork world with new areas, music, enemies, and bosses.

Sea of Stars , has released its first, and perhaps only, major DLC expansion, Throes of the Watchmaker. The award-winning turn-based RPG is currently sitting at a comfortable Very Positive rating on Steam and an impressive 97% on OpenCritic, and for good reason. Released by Sabotage Studios in 2023, Sea of Stars instantly grabbed the attention of players and critics alike, who praised almost everything about the game, from its charming art style, soundtrack, and combat design to its immersive story and charismatic cast of characters.

In November 2024, Sabotage released The Dawn of Equinox update for Sea of Stars , a comprehensive patch that added a number of features fans had been asking for. Three-player co-op was introduced to the game so that friends could experience the adventures of Valere and Zale together. Combat was revamped, including a balancing pass to incorporate player feedback, and Sea of Stars also now offers three difficulty presets to choose from. A speedrunner Relic was added to make things easier for people looking to quickly zip through the game; the Parrot Relic was also tweaked to make it more efficient at hunting down collectibles.

Sea of Stars’ free Throes of the Watchmaker update, released on May 20, is a gameplay expansion and not just an update . It introduces more than eight hours of content—featuring additional areas, dungeons, mini-games, puzzles—to explore, as well as new music from Eric W. Brown, joined by guest composer Yasunori Mitsuda. The DLC also adds more NPCs, enemies, and bosses to run into.

Sea of Stars' Throes of the Watchmaker Expansion Launches

Main characters Valere and Zale are also getting new playable classes: Zale can now become a Juggler, and Valere an Acrobat. These of course come with new attacks, damage types, and combos to try out. The pair will also run into a new friend and playable character named Arty, a friendly robot who serves as an Artificer with the ability to shoot lasers. Additionally, new figurines will be joining the lineup of characters to try out in Sea of Stars’ engaging Wheels minigame, and the three-player co-op mode introduced in The Dawn of Equinox will be available as well.

In Throes of the Watchmaker, Sea of Stars' post-game Valere and Zale will travel to the carnival-themed clockwork world of Horloge, which offers a uniquely themed location to distinguish it from the main game’s story and settings. It’s currently unknown whether Sabotage has additional content planned for Sea of Stars or whether Throes of the Watchmaker marks the final major chapter for the game. But for those who would like to see more from the developer, 2018’s side-scrolling platformer The Messenger loosely takes place in the same world, far in the future.

item.title: Mass Effect 4 Waiting Room Playlist
item.description:
Like so many of the world's best video game franchises, the Mass Effect series stands out because there's nothing else quite like it. Naturally, there have been countless sci-fi RPGs, party-based action games, and choice-driven narrative games before and after the last Mass Effect game, but no release has captured the unique character and spirit of BioWare's space opera opus.

But there have been games that are likely to appeal to Mass Effect aficionados before and since Mass Effect Andromeda , and it's these that expectant Mass Effect 4 players might be interested in checking out. After all, Mass Effect is both a culmination of early RPG video games and a seminal release within the genre, so its DNA has seeped into the fabric of the industry, unlikely to ever truly dissipate. For anyone looking to experience any of Mass Effect 's spiritual siblings, some options are better than others, especially as stopgaps between Andromeda and Mass Effect 4 .

Best Games to Play While Waiting for Mass Effect 4 To Release

  • Baldur's Gate 3
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Cyberpunk 2077
  • Dead Space 2
  • Dragon Age: Inquisition
  • Final Fantasy 7 Remake & Rebirth
  • Greedfall
  • Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
  • The Witcher 3
  • Yakuza: Like a Dragon

Mass Effect may be in a league of its own, but there are definitely some games that draw direct and obvious inspiration from it. Unsurprisingly, BioWare's other leading RPG franchise, Dragon Age, has plenty in common with Mass Effect , despite their clear differences in gameplay and world-building. Dragon Age: Inquisition may be particularly suited Mass Effect fans, as it shares the latter's unique mix of real-time action and intimate, mature storytelling, more so than its predecessors and successor. Greedfall 's developers have directly cited Dragon Age as an inspiration, but more than a bit of Mass Effect got mixed in with the recipe as well, while Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy is almost like an honorary Mass Effect writ small. And of course, BioWare's early work, especially Knights of the Old Republic , is required reading for Mass Effect fans.

But anyone looking forward to Mass Effect 4 may have already played those games, and could be casting a wider net. In that case, other contemporary RPGs with strong writing and well-written characters, such as Clair Obscur , Metaphor: ReFantazio , Yakuza: Like a Dragon , Final Fantasy 7 Remake , and Final Fantasy Rebirth , could be just what the doctor ordered. There's a fairly wide spread of experiences in this category, with the Final Fantasy 7 remake games having a strong mix of real-time and strategic, abilities-and-squad-focused combat that might land well with fans of Mass Effect 's unique gameplay flavor. Meanwhile, Like a Dragon, Clair Obscur , and Metaphor: Refantazio are turn-based games through-and-through, but their squad-based antics and lovable casts make them nice ME -chasers.

Closer to the other end of the gaming spectrum are very different, more action-oriented experiences, starting with CD Projekt Red's two most recent games, Cyberpunk 2077 and The Witcher 3 . Though these games are open-world action-RPGs that lack the linear and party-focused nature of the Mass Effect series, they are nevertheless strong alternatives for those seeking more mature, sophisticated narratives with strong combat and progression systems to boot. Their decision-based storytelling, rich worldbuilding, and stellar environment design make them even more well-suited to Mass Effect fans.

Then there's the Dead Space series, published by EA during the same period that the games giant was pushing out the core Mass Effect trilogy. Interestingly enough, the two series share some minor visual and aesthetic elements, perhaps due to nothing more than the similarities of their time, but the parallels are nevertheless notable. While Dead Space is a traditional survival horror game, and Dead Space 3 is a bog-standard shooter, Dead Space 2 falls nicely in the middle, providing balanced gameplay that Mass Effect fans might want to explore.

Mass Effect: Andromeda travels deep into the Andromeda Galaxy, far beyond the Milky Way. There, you will lead our fight for a new home in hostile territory where we are the aliens. Take command as the Pathfinder, a leader of a squad of military-trained explorers, with deep progression and customization systems. This is the story of humanity’s next chapter, and your choices throughout the game will ultimately determine our survival in the Andromeda Galaxy. As you unfold the mysteries of the Andromeda Galaxy and the hope for humanity lies on your shoulders, you must ask yourself – how far will you go?

item.title: AMD-Powered MSI Claw A8 Gaming Handheld Revealed
item.description:
Summary

  • MSI unveils AMD-powered Claw A8 BZ2EM at Computex 2025 with impressive AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme CPU and Radeon 890M graphics.
  • An 80Wh battery powers the new Claw A8 BZ2EM, almost double the Steam Deck's battery capacity.

MSI has announced the new and improved AMD-powered Claw A8 BZ2EM handheld gaming PC at Computex 2025, and there are plenty of impressive specs to get the video games industry talking. Computex is an annual computer expo held in Taipei, Taiwan, and it’s known for being one of the largest computer and technology trade shows across the globe. In addition to MSI’s handheld reveal, the 2025 show saw Nvidia debut a new NVLink Fusion program, which offers users access to the NVLink through their custom rack-scale design.

MSI (also known as Micro-Star International Co., Ltd.) is a Taiwanese multinational information technology corporation and a prolific brand in high-end gaming. MSI previously revealed the Nvidia RTX 5070 Ti release date back at the start of the year via the MSI France website, despite it being a premature announcement, but the tech titan has now unveiled an exciting new frontier for the company’s handheld gaming console.

During Computex, MSI unveiled the AMD-powered Claw A8 BZ2EM, taking a step away from Intel-exclusive handhelds to focus on AMD chips. The company’s MSI Claw 8 AI+ and Claw 7 AI+ gaming handhelds launched in late 2024, making their existence official after several rumors, but the specs for the new AMD-powered consoles are turning heads in the industry. The brand-new model features an AMD Ryzen Z2 Extreme CPU and Radeon 890M graphics with up to 24GB of RAM, accompanied by an 8-inch 1080p display with a 120Hz refresh rate, VRR support, and 500 nits of brightness.

MSI Announces AMD-Powered Claw A8 BZ2EM at Computex 2025

Despite no release date information being included in MSI’s showcase, one of the more notable features is the 80Wh battery powering the AMD-powered Claw A8 BZ2EM. For reference, the new Claw’s battery is almost double the Steam Deck’s 40Wh, and also beats the OLED model’s 50Wh. It’s no secret that MSI products carry huge price tags, but some buyers can get lucky with special deals, including a current Best Buy deal that knocks $725 off the MSI Stealth 18 AI Gaming Laptop with an Nvidia RTX 4080.

Shifting to Microsoft’s camp, the Xbox giant shared plans to enter the handheld gaming market at the start of the year, driven to combine the best aspects of Xbox and Windows. Recent news confirmed Microsoft had mobile gaming firmly in its crosshairs, and the company’s endeavor into handheld consoles aims to make Windows a better environment for handheld gaming through improved functionality and tailoring a consistent experience for gamers.
